text: Any ideas from anyone else? :sweat_smile:

Hi All

When I create a contact via API - I want to be able to see the historic web visit history associated with them.

I want to link these contacts to their previous web visit history using the GUID generated by the website tracking code and stored in the HubSpotutk cookie.

Where is the appropriate documentation that explains how to do this?

Hi Team, Wanted some opinions on Clearbit integration .
We recently did buy clearbit subscription through HubSpot as we expected an almost realtime enrichment, but during dev and integration, we are getting a latency of around 40s-50s, to enrich data sent to HubSpot. Is there a way to make it faster?

Hi All,
I'm new to HubSpot, Just found its documentation a bit complex, Could you please guide me, in implementing association batch read API, to find out the contact ids associated to deals? and please share If anybody has some API implemented boilerplate code of serverless function.
Thanks
yes 10K hard limit - you would have to filter data to get less than that and run several different filtered operations to get everything.  I don't know why that limit is there.
I can't say if I have tried filtering on the create at, updated at, etc.

Hi <@U05EC3L7UF8> you could just query the companies endpoint directly to get that filter function:
/crm/v3/objects/companies?archived=false

This will achieve the same thing

Hi All,
In HubSpot i integrated 2 way sync with google calendar. The default app. When i schedule any event in google calendar doesn't reflect in HubSpot calendar. Thanks

hi <@U04JUUACH6E>, for my project, I only need to pull records (both archived TRUE and FALSE records) that have changed since the last ELT job. I don't think that end point allows me to specify to only pull data updated after X.

Hey Everyone,
I've developed an app that creates Deals in our HubSpot account. I'd love to have a "Log In With HubSpot" button so I can restrict access to our HubSpot users and set the Deal Owner to the user. Is there any way to implement this?

From my understanding not really the only thing that comes to mind is enriching less data but I doubt that's an option, but this might be a better question for clearbit assuming you are using the integration they created if you are using another integration then I would ask whoever the provider is.
While the api can do this I would recommend doing a little reading on GraphQL it might be a bit easier to implement for your use case

thank you for that, the while loop worked, however, only about 300+ contacts where sent to our board in <http://monday.com|monday.com>, dont know why. I though it was something to do with the board itself, like the total limit of items where set to 350, but no. So I have no idea why we are only getting half of our total contact list.
are you logging errors?
yeah, no errors show at all
can you remove the monday aspect of the process and see if it proceeds?
oh nice idea, ill give it a try
check for any rate limits that you may be hitting as well.  that should throw an error, but just in case
I'd reccomend using the search api,<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search>
you would do a deal search with propertyName : associations.contact
and add more filters based on how specific or general you want to be
you are adding paging to it?
the max limit is 500 perp page so you have to adda  condition that if theres a pagination token to keep reading
yeah im paging it, however if I increase the limit above 100 my code doesnt work

ok so try this, based on your rate limits you have x calls per 10 seconds, so add a loop that if you have less than x calls and retry again, i tried that the other day with python and worked like a charm
cool! Ill see what I can do
somewhat related <https://github.com/HubSpotdev/crm-object-sync|this repo> just went public :slightly_smiling_face:
So, I tried making the call alone, without any monday stuff, and I get the total contacts returned. So that is working properly. Must be something in between thats causing this weird glitch.
at least you are getting somewhere :grin:

Hey All From Canada :flag-ca: :wave:

I’m having an issue I am wondering if anyone else here has ran into and been able to solve it. Essentially, when I create an Invoice in the UI and associate a product, I’m expecting that an instance of that product is created as a line item and associated with the invoice. This all seems to work fine. But my issue is that the instance of this line item does not have a custom property `NetSuite Internal Id` I created for the product filled out.

In the 1st screenshot below, you can see the product table showing this product has the property set to a value of 3383 but in the 2nd screenshot (response from my GET /crm/v3/objects/line_items/<line_item_id> API call) you can see the line item has no value for this property.

Any help would be greatly appreciated! :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey everyone,

Been working on a series of automation recently. Now, I am new to HubSpot. So, we have a HubSpot Form that gets some information from clients and updates our Company Properties with it. I can fetch all of the properties via a workflow trigger and send that to Google Cloud for other purposes. The one thing I am not succeeding and quite important too, is transferring the file that is uploaded via HubSpot Form as a company property. This is a boundary file that serves as an entry point into different analyses. I have done some reading, and a lot of discussions say that all files uploaded to company properties are hidden and cannot be accessed via an API. However, these discussions are quite old so I have been wondering if this has changed?

The final question:
Can I download a file that is in Company Properties (uploaded there via HubSpot Form) using the HubSpot API.

I have tried the following:
• Using the URL of the file (that if I click on it in HubSpot downloads it), I have called the API get_by_id function and I get a response 200 but the contents are HTML so I think I am getting a redirect. 
Thanks and hope everyone is having a great day
Is it possible to sort a /batch/read?

We have a framework agreement custom object where Deals are associated to the framework agreement.

We have multiple child companies competing for the same Deal. We use Deal Split to manage the revenue share. We also use Deal Split API to calculate the share based on different variables. With this we're able to properly forecast the amount.

Example: FA-Deal is created with 1M$ and shared between Comp 1, 2 and 3 evenly.
We forecast that each user from respective company have 333k $ in their pipeline

Now, there is a selection process conducted by the FA-customer, and the outcome could be that Comp 1 and 2 has won the Deal. And by using Deal Split API we "refresh" the split.
The problem is that I'm not able to see the amount that Comp 3 has lost.

*Any input on this? How can I mange the revenue Comp 3 has lost?*

*Possible solutions*
Based on some logic somewhere, create a Deal that is automatically put to closed lost using WF. Not sure how this could be triggered.

Hi,

Has anyone used Amazon AppsFlow to extract data from HubSpot?

Just a thought...

You need a preliminary step (UI Extension) which allows for a user to select who the companies are that won, what their new deal split %, and to make things easier, which company lost.

After saving, the extension function will be able to perform the updates on the current deal including modify the deal splits, removing of associations, and create the new deal with the closed-lost amount. There are probably a handful of fields/data you want to carry over to the closed-lost deal for reporting.

I also do not know if you can receive events when deal-splits take place.  You really only want to know when they get "updated" and when the deal is marked as "closed-won" or enters a specific deal stage.  The whole event trigger approach I don't think will work.
Could be worth mentioning that the FA-deal is pulling data from external Framework agreement software.
But I'll look into UI Extensions
